NavigationActivationEntry.summary: The entry read-only property of the interface contains a object representing the history entry for the inbound ("to") document in the navigation. This is equivalent to the property at the moment the inbound document was activated.

remarks.para: There are some cases in which either the from or entry objects would not be viable targets for the traverseTo() method, as they might not be retained in history. For example, the document can be activated using location.replace() or its initial entry could be replaced by history.replaceState(). However, those entries' url properties and getState() methods are still accessible.
